full_summary:
=====================================================


## Notice of Proposed Procurement

### Request for Proposal (RFP) Notice

The Department of National Defence (DND) invites Proposers to submit a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of a Rescue Unit, Emergency item (GSIN:1660, NSN:01-421-0084).

### Solicitation Details

*   **Contracting Authority**: Department of National Defence
*   **Invitation Type**: Request for Proposal
*   **Procurement Method**: Competitive bidding
*   **Trade Agreements**: This procurement may be subject to the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   **Period of Delivery**: 2023-01-30 to 2023-02-28
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: January 6, 2023
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: March 31, 2023
*   **Contact Information**: Lebel, Danny (dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca)

### Description of Procurement

The proposed procurement involves the delivery of a Rescue Unit, Emergency item (500 EA) to CFSD Montreal. The item is to be delivered according to the National Standard System (NSS) and Military Standard (MIL-STD). Proposers may offer an Equivalent or a Substitute Product, provided the brand name, model, and/or part number, and NCAGE Code, are clearly indicated in the proposal.

### Contract Terms and Conditions

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The suppliers must comply with the contract terms and conditions. The supplier's failure to comply with the contract terms and conditions may result in the termination of the contract.

### Location of Procurement

The location of procurement is at CFSD Montreal, Canada. The transport and delivery of the goods must comply with the standard measures and regulations imposed by law.

### Language and Documents

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada, as per the Official Languages Act. Suppliers must provide both an English and French version of their proposal.

### Contact Information

For more information, interested suppliers can contact Danny Lebel at dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca or visit [Canadabuys.GC.CA](http://canadabuys.gc.ca/).

### Notice of Eligibility and Exclusion

Bidders are encouraged to evaluate their eligibility for federal contracts and assess their exclusions prior to submission. Bidders must demonstrate proof of eligibility as per Schedule 6 of the contract
